title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
4 Points Maximum

One point for Description of kind of data

· Ability to produce viable seeds/offspring in nature

· Ability to cross-pollinate

· Production of fertile offspring

· Comparison of sequence of DNA or structures of other conserved molecules

· Comparison of chromosome number and/ or structure

· Fertile hybrid populations found living between the two other populations of plants
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

One point for Description of kind of data

· Ability to produce viable seeds/offspring in nature

· Ability to cross-pollinate

· Production of fertile offspring

· Comparison of sequence of DNA or structures of other conserved molecules

· Comparison of chromosome number and/ or structure

· Fertile hybrid populations found living between the two other populations of plants

The student response earns one of the following points:

One point for Description of kind of data

· Ability to produce viable seeds/offspring in nature

· Ability to cross-pollinate

· Production of fertile offspring

· Comparison of sequence of DNA or structures of other conserved molecules

· Comparison of chromosome number and/ or structure

· Fertile hybrid populations found living between the two other populations of plants

The student response earns two of the following points:

One point for Description of kind of data

· Ability to produce viable seeds/offspring in nature

· Ability to cross-pollinate

· Production of fertile offspring

· Comparison of sequence of DNA or structures of other conserved molecules

· Comparison of chromosome number and/ or structure

· Fertile hybrid populations found living between the two other populations of plants

The student response earns three of the following points:

One point for Description of kind of data

· Ability to produce viable seeds/offspring in nature

· Ability to cross-pollinate

· Production of fertile offspring

· Comparison of sequence of DNA or structures of other conserved molecules

· Comparison of chromosome number and/ or structure

· Fertile hybrid populations found living between the two other populations of plants

The student response earns four of the following points:

One point for Description of kind of data

· Ability to produce viable seeds/offspring in nature

· Ability to cross-pollinate

· Production of fertile offspring

· Comparison of sequence of DNA or structures of other conserved molecules

· Comparison of chromosome number and/ or structure

· Fertile hybrid populations found living between the two other populations of plants

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
4 Points Maximum

One point for Explanation

· Consistent with definition of biological species

· Consistent with definition of biological species

· Consistent with definition of biological species

· Sufficient similarity supports single species

· Similarity supports single species

· Consistent with definition of biological species
